~Proficiency in Religion~.Effect: Add your Level to Checks for knowing about religions, praying, performing sermons, faith, etc.

~Awe~.Effect:
Whenever you spend Mana, "cast Awe" on a Unit.
This deals 1d4 Divine Damage to enemies or heals allies for 1d4.
Some other Cleric spells will "cast Awe" for free.

~Spread the Awe~.Effect: Cast Awe 2 times on target(s) within 5 meters.

~Blessing~.Effect:
You bless one Ally.
Whenever it makes a Resist Check, it can add 1d4 to it.
~Blessing~.Upgrade: At Level 4, this affects 2 allies. At Level 8, this affects 3 allies.
~Blessing~.Notes:
You can bless yourself.
Lasts until the end of the next combat encounter.

~Pledge of Battle~.Effect:
Ask a party member Player Character to join your cause and pledge their honor to you.
They gain the Awe passive Ability (e.g. whenever they use Mana for an Ability, they cast Awe).
They also gain access to the Divine Ability List.
~Pledge of Battle~.Upgrades: There is one condition your ally must match - it can never have its Max Mana higher than yours (if it does, it becomes equal to yours).
~Pledge of Battle~.Notes:
You can only have one character who pledged for you and it must be within 100 meters to have access to all of those.
Their Awe is not improved by your Awe improvements, if you have any.

~March Ahead~.Effect:
All allies can move 3 extra meters on their next turn (and you too this turn).
After casting this, you can continue your movement.

~Piety~.Effect: Your pledged ally gains Spread the Awe.

<Eternal Bindings>.Effect:
A Unit within 3 meters makes a Sense Check.
If it fails, cast Awe on it.
It becomes magically bound to an object within 3 meters of it and can't willingly move more than 3 meters away from that object.
It rolls the Check again at the start end of their turn to escape the binding.
Lasts up to 1 minute.

<Heavy Burden>.Effect:
A Unit within 3 meters makes a Sense Check.
If it fails, cast Awe on it and it is Crippled.

<Repentance>.Effect: Heal another ally for 50% of its Max Health, then cast Awe on yourself.
<Repentance>.Notes:
You can't cast this if you are at or below 25% of your Max Health (rounded down).
If you are below 50% Health, you fall, but you are brought back due to Awe (with Exhaustion).
Round down.

<War Smite>.Effect:
When you land an Attack, roll 1d4 again and again until your roll 1.
Add them all together, and add the total to the attack.

<Shadow Realm>.Effect:
A Unit within 6 meters becomes trapped in a Shadow Realm with you for 2 rounds (this and the next).
Your attacks cast Awe on it for free while inside the Shadow Realm.
<Shadow Realm>.Upgrade:
Neither of you can interact with the outside world, but can feintly see it.
Units on the outside can faintly see the two of you, as if you were ghosts.
<Shadow Realm>.Notes: The Shadow Realm is a copy of the normal world, but with no other units.

<Holy Apex>.Effect:
Declare a 6x6 meter area.
A giant spectral fist falls onto the ground, hitting all Units there except you for 2d10 + (Round Number d6's) Divine Damage.
<Holy Apex>.Notes: E.g. on the first round of combat, this deals 2d10 + 1d6. Second round - 2d10 + 2d6. Third round - 2d10 + 3d6. And so on. Cover is applied from above if needed.

<War Mastery>.Effect: Add your Sense to the first weapon attack you make every turn.

<Divine Doubledown>.Effect: Until the end of your next turn, increase all Divine Damage done by you and your party by 100% (doubled).
<Divine Doubledown>.Notes: The increase stacks additively with other percent increases (e.g. 50% resistance + 100% increased Damage = 50% increased Damage).

<Hand of Obscurity>.Effect: When an ally (or you) is attacked, cast Awe on them, make them Invisible until the end of their next turn and they take no damage from that attack.

<Pledge of Another>.Effect: One more Player Character to pledge to you. They also gain the effects of Pledge of Battle.

<Heaviness of Words>.Effect: Your _offensive_ and healing Abilities that cost Mana cast Awe once more for each Mana spent.

<Heartstopping Awe>.Effect: You can cast Spread the Awe once more per Adventure, and the target(s) must pass a Sense Check or be Crippled and Silenced.

~Grasp~.Range: 15 meters (you don't need line of sight)
~Grasp~.Effect:
Cast Awe twice, on the same target or on two different targets.
That target(s) can't benefit from Cover for 1 minute.
~Grasp~.Notes: If the target has Cover on attacks from any source, the Cover is negated (e.g. no more -2). Includes attacks while prone, attacks through heavy wind, etc.

~Radiance~.Effect:
At all times, you radiate light in a 3 meter radius.
You can turn this on and off at will.
You are immune to being Blinded.
If you have full health, Awe Damage and healing is 1d6.

~Twilight~.Effect:
You can see in normal darkness up to 10 meters away.
You are immune to being Feared.
Awe Damage and healing is increased to 1d6 on targets at or below 50% Health.

<Let There Be Light>.Effect: While not in darkness, when you heal with Awe, half of the healing also heals the target's Reserve Health.

<Let There Be Darkness>.Effect: While in darkness, your damaging Awe die is increased by 1 tier.
<Let There Be Darkness>.Notes: Increasing the tier of dice means 1d4 becomes 1d6, 1d6 becomes 1d8, and so on. D12's and d20's don't increase.

<Circle of Awe>.Effect:
Declare a 4x4 area within 6 meters.
Now, and at the start of your next turn, cast Awe on all Units inside the area.

<Black Hole>.Effect:
You create a 1x1 Black Hole on an empty space.
Cast Grasp for free on all enemies within 6 meters of the hole.
If a Unit gets to the center of the Black Hole, it must pass a Might Check or be Rooted.
At the end of your turn, all Units within 6 meters of it are pulled 2 meters towards it.
The gravity of the black hole works even through walls and obstacles.
<Black Hole>.Notes: If 2 Units would be pulled to the center, you choose which.

<Maiming Dark>.Effect:
Stun a Unit and Daze another willing ally (not you). Then cast Awe on each.
These Units' Passive Abilities are disabled while Stunned.

<Healing Doubledown>.Effect: Until the end of your next turn, double all healing you and your party does.
<Healing Doubledown>.Notes: Doesn't stack with other healing multiplication effects.

<Inedianism>.Effect:
Whenever you cast a 0 Actions Class Ability or Talent, another ally gains 1 Mana.
Also, you don't need to eat or drink to live - you only need exposure to light.

~Second Soul~.Effect:
You have another Unit beside you, your companion.
Your companion draws power from your own spirit: it shares the same Health pool with you (e.g. whenever one of you takes Damage, the other one takes it as well). It also always has the same Defense and Checks as you, and has Speed equal to your base Speed.
Your companion has a 1-Handed Melee weapon. On its turn, it has a Half-Action which it can use to attack for 1d6 Damage without any Stat modifiers, regardless of the weapon's real Damage. It does, however, apply weapon effects, if any.
It takes its turn at the same time as you.
~Second Soul~.Notes:
Instead of attacking, your minion can do the equivalent of a Half-Action for non-combat uses, like using a potion, throwing a rope, reloading a weapon, etc, but not using a scroll. It can also use Dash or Defend.
If both of you take Damage at the same time (e.g. from an AoE effect), the Damage taken is equal to the average of the Damages taken.
Come up with a story about why you have your companion and why your god allowed this or gave them to you.

~Partner in Life~.Effect:
Your companion is an alive being. It can either be a sentient person of any race (without affecting its stats) or an animal.
Choose two of the following boons. Your companion will have them forever.

Values: Your companion is sentient and intelligent, and gains the Mana Tap Ability from the Elf Race
Your companion is Large and starts every combat with Shielding equal to your Level (lasts until the end of the combat)
You can ride your companion without penalties as a mount, and it has +2 Speed and ignores Hard Terrain
Your companion's attacks now have 5 meter range and deal Divine Damage, regardless of the weapon type
When an enemy exists companion's melee attack range, it can make an attack on it with its Reaction

~Partner in Life~.Notes:
While riding your companion, it can still attack, but mounting and dismounting takes either a Half-Action or all of your own total Movement.
Note that the Shielding (if you choose it) is on your companion, not on you; it absorbs Damage only if your companion takes it. If you're both hit at the same time, the Shielding applies.

~True Necromancy~.Effect:
Your companion is an undead. It can either be a sentient undead person of any race (without affecting its stats) or an abstract undead creature.
Choose two of the following boons. Your companion will have them forever.

Values: Your companion is Large and starts every combat with Shielding equal to your Level (lasts until the end of the combat)
Your companion takes only 50% Slashing and Necrotic Damage
Instead of attacking, your Companion can just do 3 Damage (of its weapon type) to all Units within 2 meters of it
For 0 Actions, you can sacrifice your companion to cast Awe on all Units within 5 meters of it (this has a Once / Adventure). Your Companion stays dead for the rest of the Adventure.
Once per turn, when your companion walks over a corpse, cast Awe on an enemy within 1 meter of your companion and the corpse is destroyed.

~True Necromancy~.Notes: Note that the Shielding (if you choose it) is on your companion, not on you; it absorbs Damage only if your companion takes it. If you're both hit at the same time, the Shielding applies.

~Renounce~.Effect: You renounce your companion, and effectively disable them. Your Max Health increases by 4. You no longer lose the Max Mana, and all upcoming Talents that affect your companion affect you instead.

<Awe For Corpses>.Effect:
If there are any nearby corpses, your Awe raises a zombie from it instead of "casting Awe".
Zombies have 1 Health and 0 Defense, 3 Speed and they can use their Action to attack for 1d4 Damage (Slash, Smash or Pierce, your choice).
They take their turn on your turn.
<Awe For Corpses>.Notes: Zombies have -1 in all Stats. When a Zombie dies, it becomes a corpse again.

<Awe For Life>.Effect: Cast Awe once on each Worthy Unit within 10 meters of you.
<Awe For Life>.Notes: Player Characters also are Worthy Units, but not their pets and summons.

<Ascendance>.Effect:
Your Awe die is increased by one Tier (e.g. from 1d4 to 1d6).
You gain Wingspan (Cleric) and Penitence.
You start every Adventure with one extra Inspiration Point.

~Wingspan (Cleric)~.Upgrades: At Levels 7 and 9, you get one extra use of Wingspan per Adventure (e.g. the Cooldown becomes 2 times / Adventure, 3 times / Adventure, etc).

~Penitence~.Effect: A target must pass a Charisma Check or it can't cast healing Spells, do Crowd Control or apply On-Roll Effects.
~Penitence~.Notes: Can't be cast on Epic Monsters.

<Cleric Lich Ritual>.Effect:
You spend 24 hours in a special place of power (this could be a temple or given to you by your GM).
After it's finished, you become a Lich, and you are considered Undead.
Apply the following:
{Diamond} You are Undead, thus immune to Charm, Fear and being put to Sleep
{Diamond} You can no longer cast Basic Abilities that don't cost Mana, but gain 2 extra Max Mana. Passive Spells that don't cost Mana still apply.
{Diamond} You no longer need to eat, drink or sleep.
{Diamond} You gain access to the Elemental and Eldritch Basic Ability Lists.
{Diamond} Your Max Health decreases by 3
You also gain the Phylactery and Dismorphment Abilities.
<Cleric Lich Ritual>.Upgrade:
At Level 6, your Defense increases by 1.
At Level 7, the range of all your Spells is doubled.
At Level 8, Spell Grade increases by 1.
At Level 9, all your Checks increase by 1.
At Level 10, your Max Health increases by 5.

~Phylactery~.Effect:
When you become a Lich, you place your soul inside a Phylactery - a special object, dear to you.
When you would reach 0 Health, instead of going Fallen, you can instantly teleport your body inside the Phylactery.
A spellcaster can channel when resting inbetween Adventures to resummon you near the Phylactery with full Health, Spells, etc.
If the Phylactery is destroyed, you must wait 1 year to make another one.

~Dismorphment~.Effect:
When a Unit declares an attack or Spell on you, you can instantly teleport up to 3 meters away.
That Unit can keep their action or change it.
You can also instantly teleport using 0 Actions on your turn.
~Dismorphment~.Notes: Remember that at Level 6, the range of this becomes 6 as per the description of Cleric Lich Ritual.

~Death Pact~.Effect:
Choose an ally (or yourself).
They lose 5 Health. You gain 1 Mana this turn only.

<Army of Death>.Effect:
All your summons and minions instantly transform into Death Ghouls.
Death Ghouls have 15 Health, 1 in all Stats, 7 meters speed and their attacks deal 1d10 Damage.
They take their turns on your turn (if they haven't already).
<Army of Death>.Notes: After 1 minute, they transform back to how they were previously. If your companion ghoul dies, it transforms to how it previously was. If other minions ghouls die, they remain dead.

<Presence of Fear>.Effect:
All enemies within 5 meters must pass a Sense Check or be Feared.
For each Enemy Feared, cast Awe (on anyone).

<Sanctuary>.Duration: Until the start of your next turn
<Sanctuary>.Effect:
Choose a 6x6 meter area. Cast Awe on all Units there.
No Enemy can willingly enter the area or attack Units inside the area.

~Proficiency in Nature~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for identifying plants, knowing about nature and the wilds, etc.

~Druidcraft~.Effect:
{Diamond} You speak Druidic, an ancient form of conveying information through nature.
{Diamond} You can create harmless sensory effects or tiny weather effects (6 meters range).
{Diamond} You can massively speed up the growth of small plants (touch by touch).
{Diamond} You can slightly soothe physical pains (with no combat effect) (by touch).
{Diamond} You can attempt to convey simple ideas to animals and plants (3 meters range) that you would not normally be able to convey.
{Diamond} You have +3 on rolls for identifying plants, monsters or monster lairs
~Druidcraft~.Notes: You can do these even while Shapeshifted.

~Shapeshift~.Effect:
Pick an animal from the Pets and Animals list and instantly transform into it.

For Checks, you can choose to use the animal's Stats or your Stats.
You also gain its exact Abilities and Animal Attack (see below), but can't cast Spells or use items (obviously).
Your Health stays the same, but you use that animal's Defense.

Shapeshift ends if you drop to 0 Health, and you Fall.
~Shapeshift~.Upgrade:
At first, you can't fly, even if your animal can. If your animal can fly, you have Proficiency in Jumping and you can glide (you don't take falling Damage).
From Level 3, you can use this 3 times per Adventure.
From Level 6, you can use this 4 times per Adventure and you can fly.
From Level 9, you can use this 5 times per Adventure.
~Shapeshift~.Notes:
You choose what items you keep on you when Shapeshifting, and those items are 'merged' into your new form.
You can turn back into your person form for 0 Actions (on your turn).
While Shapeshifted, you can speak, but your voice is slightly altered to match your shape (e.g. guttural for lions, high pitched for birds, etc).

~Animal Attack~.Effect: Make a melee attack for 1d6 + your Sense (not the animal's).

~Circle of the Land~.Effect: Choose one _domain_. Each _domain_ gives you extra powers.

~Nature Domain~.Effect: You can cast Talent Abilities and Spells from the Nature Basic Ability List while Shapeshifted.

~Water Domain~.Effect: Whenever you heal someone else with a Spell, heal them for another 1d4.
~Water Domain~.Notes: Only works for Acts (doesn't work for Passive or Passive-like Spells).

~Cold Domain~.Effect: You gain +1 on all Resist Checks, +4 Max Health and you only take 50% Cold Damage.

~Rough Domain~.Effect:
After you attack with a real, non-bodily weapon, your next Animal Attack deals an extra 1d4 Damage.
Stacks up to 2 times (maximum bonus of 2d4).
~Rough Domain~.Notes: Only weapons in the weapons list trigger this (e.g. not Improvised Attacks, punching, biting, etc).

<Old Ritual>.Effect:
Regain up to 3 Mana.
The Old Ritual must be performed outdoors, in a safe, uncorrupted place untouched by regular folk.
<Old Ritual>.Downside: If you have this Talent, you lose the Shapeshift Ability, and you can't choose upcoming Talents that improve Shapeshift.
<Old Ritual>.Notes: You can't have more than your maximum amount of Mana.

<Beastly Fortitude>.Effect: Whenever you Shapeshift into an animal specific to your _domain_, heal for 1d4.
<Beastly Fortitude>.Notes: You are allowed to use the variant animal suggestions for each animal. Of course, some animals can correspond to multiple domains (e.g. bears can live both in nature (forests) and in cold (snowy) domains).

<Innervate>.Effect: Heal another ally for 1d10 Health and it regains 1 Mana or provides 1 more use of an Ability that is on Cooldown.
<Innervate>.Downside: Can not be cast on Druids.

<Primal Surge>.Effect: Heal yourself for 50% of your missing Health, and all Units within 2 meters for 25% of your missing Health.

<Dazzling Miasma>.Effect:
Shoot a tainted gust of spores in a 10x1 meter line from your position.
It hits the first 2 Units it travels into.
If you hit one Unit, it must pass a Might Check or take 10d4 Poison Damage (or half of that if it passes).
If you hit 2 Units, each must pass a Might Check or be Stunned and take 5d4 Poison Damage (or half of that if they pass).

<Druid Animal Companion>.Effect:
You have an animal pet that can fight alongside you, but your Mana pool is permanently decreased by 1, and your total Health by 5.
Your animal has stats depending on its species. Check out the Pets and Animals page to see its stats!
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same initiative as yours.
Your pet has 1 Action per turn, which it can use to do its own Abilities.
Your pet can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
All pets have the Pet Attack ability.
<Druid Animal Companion>.Upgrade: If your pet drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no reserve Health, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your pet's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Druid Animal Companion>.Notes:
If your pet raises from being Fallen, it has Pet Exhaustion (is Slowed and can only use Pet Attack, but all Pet Attacks have Cover, which is a -2 to the attack).
Tr

<Pet Attack>.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 Pierce of Slash Damage (your choice).

<Regrowth>.Effect:
Choose a Unit.
Now and at the start of your next turn, heal it for 1d10 for each 10 Health it is missing.

<Wicked Animals>.Effect:
Call upon 2 animals, both of which are specific to your _domain_, but have Max Health as if they were 4 Levels lower than you.
They appear on the edge of the battlefield, from the wilderness, and they fight for you for up to 1 minute.
<Wicked Animals>.Notes: Both animals must be of the same type. This is considered a Spell.

<Lycanthropy>.Effect:
Once per _twilight_ (18:00 to 6:00), you can use Shapeshift to transform into a Lycanthrope until the end of your next turn.
While a Lycanthrope, you can't willingly shift to another form, and you must Animal Attack with all of your Actions, otherwise you take 5 Damage for each Half-Action spent elsehow.
<Lycanthropy>.Upgrade: Every Worthy _midnight_, if this is not on Cooldown, roll 1d20. If you roll 20, you automatically transform into a Lycanthrope. This rule can be overridden by the GM.
<Lycanthropy>.Notes:
While a Lycanthrope, you have one extra Half-Action per turn, can Break your Movement and Pet Attack heals you for half of the Damage done.
Additionally, you have a base speed of 8 meters, and can use Ominous Howl, which Fears all Units that can hear you for a Half-Action, once per Adventure.

~Wild Shape~.Effect:
After using Shapeshift, you gain back the Half-Action spent on it.
When you use Shapeshift, you can transform into a combination of 2 animals.
You take the highest Stat from both animals, and you have access to both of their Abilities.
~Wild Shape~.Notes:
For example, you could transform into a combination of Bird of Prey and Bear, resulting in a Bowlear, with Shielding and a lot of Defense! Be creative!
The animal size is either the larger or the smaller of the two - your choice.
Even if you Shapeshift into 2 combinations of a same animal, the cooldown of that animal's Ability persists (e.g. you can't use Bear's Maul twice per Adventure, no matter what animal combination you transform into).

<Forest Friend>.Effect:
You have a flying Pixie companion, a very small person with wings.
The Pixie has 5 Defense, 5 Health, 5 meters Movement Speed.
It takes its turn at the same time as you. While in combat, on its turn, it has the equivalen of 1 Action, and can either melee attack for 1 Force Damage or heal a non-Fallen Unit for 1 Health. Instead of that, it can also use Taunt or use consumable items like potions or scrolls.
<Forest Friend>.Upgrade:
If it goes more than 50 meters away from you, it becomes unsummoned (you can summon it back by channeling for 10 minuets).
The Pixie has Charisma, Sense and Intelligence equal to yours, but its Dexterity is 0 and its Might is -5.
<Forest Friend>.Notes: The Pixie can stay in your backpack or pocket if you don't want it to take Damage. Decide with your GM whether you or the GM controls the Pixie roleplay-wise, and whether it is sentient. Have fun!

<Treesposition>.Effect:
Touch a large or larger piece of wood and choose one of the following:
1. Teleport near another large or larger piece of wood within 8 meters.
2. Partially enter the piece of wood, becoming camouflaged. You have +5 Stealth until you exit back to your normal space.
You can stay like that for up to 1 hour.
You benefit from Cover while inside a tree.
As a Reaction, you can use this when you are attacked or right when someone casts a spell (before the roll).
<Treesposition>.Notes: If you use this as a Reaction and the attack would fail (out of range, no line of sight, etc), the attacker can then choose a different Act or target.

<Exotic Shapeshift>.Effect:
You can now Shapeshift into Exotic Animals.
You can also use Shapeshift to also transform into other people.
When you want to do this, roll a Deception check.
This check determines how close you get to the form of that person (12 or more means a perfect copy).
This copy just mimicks the look of the person, not the voice or personality.
<Exotic Shapeshift>.Notes:
You can cast your own spells while transformed into someone else.
Other people are not considered Animals, so you can't use Wild Shape to transform into a combination of a person and an Animal.

<Shapeshift Ally>.Effect:
Passively, you get 2 more uses of Shapeshift per Adventure.
Choose a willing Ally and Shapeshift them into a standard animal of your choice.
They have Animal Attack and all of the animal's Abilities.
They can cancel it for 0 Actions on their turn.

<Strangevolution>.Effect: When you gain this Talent, gain 2 racial Ablities, from any Race(s).

<Dryad Ancestry>.Effect: You can cast Spells while Shapeshifted. Gain 1 extra Max Mana and access to one more Basic Ability List of choice.

<Evershape>.Effect: When Shapeshifting yourself, it doesn't consume a ^use^.
<Evershape>.Notes: This means that unless you use Shapeshift Ally, you can Shapeshift as much as you like. Note that the Cooldowns of Animal Abilities persist and don't reset.

<Werebeast Blood>.Effect: You can Shapeshift into a combination of 3 animals. You gain 7 Max Health.
<Werebeast Blood>.Upgrade: In addition, you're free to just choose one animal at first when you use Shapeshift, then freely add animals to the combination if you need their Abilities. Build-a-werebeast, step by step!

<Beastly Stamina>.Effect: For each animal, you gain an extra use of their Abilities that have a Cooldown of Once / Adventure.

~Day Night Cycle~.Effect:
You have access to the Arcane and Elemental Ability Lists, but you can only use Arcane Abilities at _twilight_, and Elemental Abilities at _day_.
You may spend 1 hour of non-combat to change your Known Abilities.
You always know if it's day or night, even if indoors.
~Day Night Cycle~.Notes: _Twilight_ is from 18:00 to 6:00. _Day_ is from 6:00 to 18:00.

~Moonsun Fire~.Effect:
A target makes a Sense Check.
If it fails, it takes 1d8 + Main Stat Fire Damage and is Crippled (if _day_) or True Damage and is Silenced (if _twilight_).
It takes half of that Damage if it passes.
If you use this at _twilight_, you can't use it until _day_, and vice versa.

<Improved Moonsun Fire>.Effect:
If _day_, Moonsun Fire also burns the target for 10% of its total Health as Fire Damage.
If _twilight_, Moonsun Fire heals a target you choose within 6 meters for the same Damage dealt.

<Sunrise/Moonfall>.Effect: Moonsun Fire now hits one extra target, deals 1d4 extra Damage and ignores Defense and Resistances.

<Equinox>.Effect: Your next Spell (this turn or next) casts twice.
<Equinox>.Upgrade: If you use this with Shapeshift, you can combine into 2 animals, and have both their Abilities and their highest Stats.
<Equinox>.Notes: On the second cast, you can choose different targets, areas, etc (and it ignores Cooldown, Costs, etc). Works on Spells with cast time longer than 1 Action (e.g. Old Ritualist).

<Shapeshift Fire>.Effect: Whenever you Shapeshift into an animal specific to the current time of day, cast Moonsun Fire for free, ignoring its Cooldown.
<Shapeshift Fire>.Notes: The chosen animal must be approved by the GM to trigger the free Moonsun Fire.

<Star Fall>.Effect: If _day_, heal a Unit for 6d12. If _twilight_, deal 7d6 Force Damage to a Unit.

<Forced Eclipse>.Effect: Through ancient weather witchcraft, you force 1 minute of artificial day or night in a 1km area around you.
<Forced Eclipse>.Upgrade: This can reset the Cooldown of Moonsun Fire's, once when it happens, and again when it ends.
<Forced Eclipse>.Notes: Nothing happens if used with Equinox.

~Proficiency in Hearing~.Effect: Add your Level to all Sense Checks for hearing (e.g. over-hearing dialogue, noticing unusual sounds, discerning sounds, etc).

~Proficiency in Smelling~.Effect: Add your Level to all Sense Checks for sensing smells and identifying things based on their scent.

~Animal Companion~.Effect:
You have an animal pet that can fight alongside you! Check out the {Pets and Animals} page and choose an Animal from the Pets section!
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same Initiative as yours, and can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
It has 1 Action per turn, which it can use to do its own Abilities or Pet Attack.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
~Animal Companion~.Upgrade: If your pet drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no reserve Health, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your pet's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
~Animal Companion~.Notes:
Your pet can't rise from being Fallen while in combat, even if healed.
If your pet ever dies, you can spend 8 hours inbetween Adventures to get a new pet. If you want to change your Pet and abandon your current one, you can do so inbetween Adventures, but the guilt will make you Fumbling for the next 2 Worthy Combat encounters.

~Pet Attack~.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 Pierce or Slash Damage (your choice).

~Tumble~.Effect:
Roll 2 meters in any possible direction.
Use when a Unit declares an attack or Ability.
~Tumble~.Notes: You can use this to dodge an area Ability or go out of Line of Sight (or behind Cover). The attack carries on if it still has Line of Sight. Otherwise, it must choose something else to do, as if the Act never happened.

~Tracker~.Effect:
You gain Proficiency in Tracking, meaning you can add your Level to all Sense checks for tracking a creature and learning about its size, if it's part of a group or pack, if it's injured or roughly how far away it is.
You always know where North is in non-magical environments.
You and your pets are unaffected by Hard Terrain.

~Hunter Mark~.Effect:
Choose and mark a target you can see.
Your own single target attacks and Abilities against the marked target have the Damage dice increased by 1 tier.
~Hunter Mark~.Notes:
Increasing dice by 1 tier means, for example, d6 become d8, or d10 become d12.
D12's and d20's don't increase.
Your pets' attacks don't increase.
A Unit can only have one Hunter Mark on it at a time.

<Slay>.Effect:
You always know the type of a monster.
You gain a different bonus when fighting an enemy of a certain type:
Monstrosities: Attacks against Monstrosities ignore Defense and Resistances.
Beasts: You have +1 Defense and +1 to all Resist Checks against Beasts.
Fiends: Your Acts against Fiends that use at least a Half-Action (or Reaction) deal 1d4 extra Damage.
Undead: You have +2 Spell Grade against Undead.

<Flare Shot>.Effect:
Quickly shoot a flare at a target point.
The area around the flare lights up in a 6 meter radius, creating normal light.
When cast, all allies in the area are cleared of Stun, Fear or Cripple.
Allies in the area have Advantage on rolls against Fear.
The flare lasts 1 minute.

<Crosshair Shot>.Effect:
Make an attack on a target.
For each meter to the target, the attack deals 1d6 Pierce Damage, up to 7 meters.
For each meter to the target over 7 meters, deal one less d6.
<Crosshair Shot>.Notes: At exactly 7 meters range, the attack deals 7d6 Damage. At 6 and 8 meters, it deals 6d6. At 5 and 9 meters, 5d6. And so on.

<Running Mark>.Effect:
You can use Tumble one more time per Adventure.
Immediately after you Tumble, you can freely use Hunter Mark, ignoring its Cooldown.

<Tremor Wave>.Effect:
Shoot a thundering shot towards an obstacle or wall. A quaking wave travels horizontally towards in both directions of the wall up to 10 meters in each direction.
All Units within 2 meters of that wall must pass a Might Check or be Stunned and take 3d4 Shock Damage.
They take half of the Damage and are Slowed if they pass.
<Tremor Wave>.Notes: The floor and ceiling are not considered walls. The wave does not travel through them. This is considered a Spell. Ignores Cover.

<Improved Hunter Mark>.Effect: Hunter Mark increases the dice by an extra tier (e.g. from d6 to d10) and your Pet's Damage benefits from Hunter Mark.

<Attack Mark>.Effect: When you cast Hunter Mark, your Pet immediately dashes to the target and performs a Pet Attack if it's within 6 meters of the target.
<Attack Mark>.Notes: Your Pet lands on the closest space near the target.

<Leafwalk>.Effect: Become invisible until the end of your next turn (or for 12 seconds if not in combat). Doing any Act heals you for 1d4 while invisible.

~Warden~.Effect:
When you become a Warden, choose a Basic Ability List from Bloodshed, Elemental, Divine, and Arcane.
You now have access to that Basic Ability List as well, permanently (this can not be changed).
You have 1 extra Max Mana.
Also, you can Know a number of extra Abilities equal to your Intelligence (at least 1).

~Quick Magic~.Effect: After using Tumble or one of your Pet's Abilities that has a "Once / Adventure" Cooldown, immediately cast Burning Breath, Flash or Vault Break for free (see the Abilities list).
~Quick Magic~.Notes: For quick reference: Burning Breath deals 4 Damage in a 3x3 meter area near you; Flash teleports you up to 6 meters away; Vault Break destroys a medium obstacle within 3 meters.

<Watcher Form>.Effect:
You take on a special form, called a Watcher Form.
While in this form, your first Attack deals +2d4 extra Damage once per turn, you gain +2 Spell Grade and +2 to all Resist Checks.
Also, when you cast a Spell (before you do; excluding this), you can instantly dash 3 meters, ignoring attacks of oportunity, and going through enemies and small obstacles or medium gaps.
<Watcher Form>.Notes: Your body becomes engulfed in a magical aura (you choose its color), your eyes glow, and you can gain other aesthetics-only body transformations (customize it with your DM).

<Combo Set>.Effect: You gain Quickfire, Parry and Tumblestrike. Quick Magic will also trigger after you use Quickfire and Parry.

<Quickfire (Hunter)>.Effect:
Perform an attack with a 1-Handed weapon (for 0 Actions).
This attack ignores Cover and has no pentaly if you're Blinded or Fumbling.
This attack can be used in melee range without penalty if it's a ranged weapon.

<Parry>.Effect: When a Unit makes a melee attack with a weapon on you (after you see the roll), you can block this attack and it deals 0 Damage.

<Tumblestrike>.Effect: After you Tumble or Parry, your next weapon Attack or single target Ability has the dice tiers increased.
<Tumblestrike>.Notes:
For example, instead of 2d6, an attack would be 2d8.
D12's and d20's don't increase; they stay d12 and d20.

<Warden Corral>.Effect:
Declare a 6x6 meter zone and it becomes engulfed in a special magical aura.
All Units have 0 Defense and their Passive Abilities don't work while in that zone.
The zone lasts until the start of your next turn.
<Warden Corral>.Notes: Rounded down (e.g. 3 becomes 0, 5 becomes 1). The zone is often subtle, and not all monsters may notice it.

<Wind Wall>.Effect:
Use when an enemy or enemy group make an attack.
Create a 4x4 meter wall of powerful Wind that destroys all projectiles.
It can't be passed through from the direction it is facing towards.
Lasts for 1 minute.
<Wind Wall>.Notes:
The wall pushes objects or willing Units away from it and can be used as a platform.
If you decide to place it horizontally, it acts as Hard Terrain.

<Hexblade (Hunter)>.Effect: After you cast an _offensive_ Spell that costs Mana, your next Weapon attack deals +1d6 Damage.

<Quicker Magic>.Effect: Quick Magic also trigger whenever you spend Mana on a Spell.

~Prowl Around~.Effect: You have +2 to all Sense Checks.
~Prowl Around~.Notes: This is because of your Animal Companions roaming about.

~Stablemaster~.Effect:
You have 3 different Animal Companion pets, but only one can adventure with you at a time.
While not with you, your other Animal Companions hang out on their own in the wilderness, but no more than 5 kilometers away from you.
You can send your current companion off, then spend 30 minutes to telepathically call another one to come join you.
~Stablemaster~.Notes:
The advantage is you can use several animal Abilities that have longer Cooldowns; these are usually stronger.
It is possible that the animal you're calling can't come to your aid if you're indoors, flying or the trail you're on is too difficult. In that case, you will have to return outside or on a safe trail (GM's decision).
In that case, your current companion can not go away, either.

<Exotic Double>.Effect:
One more of your Animal Companions accompanies you while adventuring.
This Animal Companion obeys the same rules as the regular one (takes its turns, requires healing between combats, etc), except its Pet Attack deals only 1d4 Damage (you choose which of them).
One of your 3 Animal Companions can be an Exotic Animal.
<Exotic Double>.Notes: You're instantly kicked from the group if your pets don't have names.

<Large Double>.Effect:
One more of your Animal Companions accompanies you while adventuring.
This Animal Companion obeys the same rules as the regular one (takes its turns, requires healing between combats, etc), except its Pet Attack deals only 1d4 Damage (you choose which of them).
One of your 3 Animal Companions grows to become Large. Its Max Health increases by 50% and its attack range by 1.

<Wild Single>.Effect:
All your Animal Companions are combinations of 2 different Animals from the Animals List, and have the highest Stats of the two and both Abilities. All your Animal Companions must be combinations of all different Animals.
Your Animal Companion's Pet Attack Damage becomes 1d10.

<Ravage!>.Effect:
One pet makes a melee Attack for 5d6 Slash Damage.
If the target is at or below 50% Health, deal 2d6 extra Damage and the target halves all healing it receives for the rest of the encounter.
<Ravage!>.Notes: This takes 1 Action from YOU, not your pet.

<Sickem>.Effect:
Use when a Unit goes flying against its will on someone else's turn.
Your pet(s) within 5 meters of its landing place can dash to it (after it lands) and make a total of 2 Pet Attacks on it.
<Sickem>.Notes:
Goes flying means is pushed, knocked up, dragged, etc.
This uses YOUR Reaction, not your pets'.
Obviously, the pets need line of sight and can't jump through walls, or over large obstacles. Apply common sense.

<Coordinated Bite>.Effect: One enemy near each of your pets (and/or summons) must pass a Might Check or become Crippled.

<Call To Action>.Effect: Call to one more of your animal companions! It appears from the wilderness and fights for up to 1 minute as if it were a normal Animal Companion.

<Second Winds>.Effect: Instantly heal yourself and all your pets for 3d6.

~Proficiency in General Knowledge~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for knowing various simple facts about science, astronomy, trades, etc.

~Proficiency in Arcane~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks related to magic (e.g. identifying spells, magic items or runes, knowledge about magic, etc).

~Magic Mastery~.Effect: The next Ability you use that has the cost of 1 Action now costs a Half-Action.
~Magic Mastery~.Notes: This is not considered a Spell.

~Learn Scrolls~.Effect: If you have a Scroll that contains a Basic Ability (e.g. from Arcane, Nature, etc), you can destroy it to Know it permanently, without needing to learn it inbetween Adventures.
~Learn Scrolls~.Notes: You can not learn Class Abilities from Scrolls. Of course, you still need to spend Mana and respect the Cooldown of said Ability.

~Magic Expertise~.Effect: For you, all Basic Spells have their Level requirement lowered by 3.
~Magic Expertise~.Notes: E.g. You can learn Reverse Gravity from Level 3 (which would normally require Level 6).

<Pyromancy>.Effect: The first time hit 2 or more Worthy Enemies with a Spell every turn, increase all Fire Damage you deal by 1 for the rest of the combat.

<Conjurism>.Effect: Whenever you spend any amount of Mana on a Conjuration Spell, give a Unit you can see Shielding equal to your current Mana (after the cast).

<Arcanism>.Effect: Whenever you spend any amount of Mana on an Arcane Spell, shoot a magic missile at a target within 10 meters that instantly deals 1d4 Force Damage and ignores Defense and Cover.

<Eldritchianism>.Effect:
You gain access to the Eldritch Basic Ability List, and when you cast a Spell, you can choose to split the d8's into 2d4's and d12's into 2d6's.
Also, add your Intelligence to your Initiative.
<Eldritchianism>.Notes:
For example, if a Spell deals 2d8 Damage, that becomes 4d4.
It might sound like the same thing, but because of math, 4d4 is actually, on average, 1 extra Damage compared to 2d8.

<Hydromancy>.Effect: Whenever you apply Crowd Control other than Slows to a Unit in a Worthy Combat, increase all Cold Damage you deal by 2 for the rest of the combat.
<Hydromancy>.Notes: Hard Terrain does not count as Crowd Control.

<Abjuration>.Effect:
Use when an ally (or you) would be hit by a missile (before hitting the target).
Fling it from air back to the attacker (with the exact Damage and effects).

<Animation>.Effect:
Whenever you spend Mana on a Spell that doesn't deal Damage, you can pick a Large or Medium object within 6 meters and bring it to life.
It has 3 Speed, can fly and can attack for 1d4 Smash, Slash or Pierce Damage.
Lasts 1 minute or until it takes Damage (after which it returns to its inanimate form).
<Animation>.Notes: Alternatively, it can use Dash, Push or Taunt once.

<Illusionism>.Effect:
After you use Magic Mastery, choose an ally.
Create a clone of them on a space within 2 meters of them, and teleport the ally 2 meters in any direction (as to create a diversion).
The clone has the same Health and other stats, but takes 300% of the Damage it takes.
The clone can pretend to do anything the ally can do. If it attacks with a weapon or Spell, it can do at most 1 Psychic Damage per attack Act.
<Illusionism>.Upgrade: An enemy can't tell which Unit is real and which is the clone until the clone does something relevant and the Unit has at least 3 Intelligence.
<Illusionism>.Notes: E.g. the clone could cast Magic Missiles, but only one missile will deal 1 Damage (you can choose which, and apply Cover, Defense and other penalties normally - e.g. 1 Damage with Cover becomes 0 Damage). Alternatively, for example, it could attack twice with a one-handed weapon for 1 Damage each.

<Spellcraft>.Effect:
When you cast a spell, you can apply this any of the following effects to it:
{Diamond} For every 2 dice in its Damage, roll 1 more
{Diamond} If it targets an area, increase it or decrease it by 50%
{Diamond} Change its Damage type to any type, except Divine and True Damage
{Diamond} Change it's Check Stat to any other Stat (if it requires a Check)
{Diamond} Swap Root, Cripple or Silence
{Diamond} Swap Slow, Fumbling, Rooted or Pushing with any other of these (Push a target 2 meters away from you or from the zone center)
{Diamond} Double its range
At any point, you can expend 1 Mana to reset the Cooldown of this Spell (Spellcraft).

<Grand Wizardry>.Effect:
Magic Mastery becomes usable 2 more times per Adventure.
Basic Spells that cost Mana and have a Cooldown have no Cooldown for you.

<Destruction>.Effect: Whenever you deal Damage with a Spell that cost Mana or was affected by Magic Mastery, zap a Unit within 4 meters for ^your Intelligence^ Shock Damage.

<Evocation>.Effect:
Take the form of an _evoker_ - a being made of pure energy.
While in the _evoker_ form, all Damage you deal from all sources becomes Force Damage, and all your spells that cost 2 or more Mana now cost 1 less.
You can breathe underwater and fly at normal Speed.
<Evocation>.Notes: You can't end your turn inside an obstacle, and you can't move through walls, ceilings and floors.

<Chronomancy>.Effect:
Instantly return to how and where you were at the start of your turn (or your previous turn if it's not currently your turn), with that same Movement, Actions, Health, Shielding, Buffs and Cooldowns (not Mana, though).
Alternatively, if you're out of combat, you can turn back time for all the world up to 10 minutes, exactly how it was, but retaining all your information from the future. Allies don't retain the information.

<Graviturgy>.Duration: Until the start of your next turn
<Graviturgy>.Effect:
Choose a 5x5x5 meter cube.
That zone become frozen in time - Units skip their turns and can't be damaged or affected by anything.
Any object that touches the area becomes frozen, too (and, if it is a missile, resumes its trajectory when the zone ends).

~Unstable Spark~.Effect:
At the start of your every turn in a Worthy Combat, roll 1d10.
If you roll 10, your first Spell this turn becomes affected by Magic Mastery if possible, regardless of its Cooldown.

~Overcharge~.Effect: After you cast a Basic Spell in a Combat, you can no longer cast that Spell until the Combat ends, regardless of its Cooldown.

<Sap>.Effect: A Unit must pass a Charisma Check or be Crippled, Silenced or Rooted (your choice).

<Mild Magic>.Effect: After you manually use Magic Mastery, for the rest of the combat, ignore the limits of Overcharge.

<Wild Magic>.Effect:
When you roll the Unstable Spark d10, if you roll 1 or 2, roll another 1d20 and a random Spell is automatically cast from the table below on a target/Unit "randomly" chosen by the GM.
If you roll 1, the effect will be negative for your team, if possible. If you roll 2, the effect is positive, if possible.
<Wild Magic>.Notes:
For example, if you roll 1 and the random Spell is Fire Enchantment, it will be cast on an enemy's weapon if possible (respecting the range). If not possible, then it will be cast on a random, non-Player Character's weapon. If not possible, then it will be cast on a Player Character's weapon. If nothing is possible, nothing happens.
If an effect can be cancelled or has ongoing effects, you have control of them as if you yourself had cast the Spell.

<Arcane Comet>.Effect:
Shoot a comet that changes in power the longer it travels - it deals Damage and Crowd Controls a target.
It attacks for 1d6 Force Damage for every meter it travels (up to 8d6).
However, the longer it travels, the weaker it's Crowd Control is.
Apply the following Crowd Control (directly, without a Check) to the target depending on the distance traveled (distance between you and the target):
{Diamond} 1 or 2 meters: Stun
{Diamond} 3 or 4 meters: Fumbling
{Diamond} 5 or 6 meters: Root
{Diamond} 7 or 8 meters: None

<Star Burst>.Effect:
Declare up to 4 different targets within 15 meters.
Assign a different number from #1 to #4 to each.
Roll a number of d4's equal to double your Intelligence or Charisma (whichever is higher). Each number deals that much Force Damage to the target with that number.
Each rolled 1 deals 1 Damage to target number #1.
Each rolled 2 deals 2 Damage to target number #2.
And so on.
<Star Burst>.Notes:
E.g. if you put #2 on a goblin, and you roll three 2's on the d4's, then that goblin takes 6 Force Damage.
You should probably assign the higher number to the target you want to do most Damage to.
You can declare fewer targets, but then the missing number will deal Damage to no target.
Cover is applied normally.

<Honorificabilitudinitatibus>.Effect: Your single-target Spells that deal half Damage when a target passes a Check now deal the full Damage regardless.
<Honorificabilitudinitatibus>.Notes: That means spells like Acid Burst don't even require a Check anymore.

<Great Sorcery>.Effect:
Whenever you roll 8 or 9 on the Unstable Spark die, reset the Cooldown of Magic Mastery.
Additionally, Magic Mastery can now reduce the Actions cost of any Spell from a Half-Action to 0 Actions.

<Accidental Zap>.Effect: When you roll 7, 8 or 9 on the Unstable Spark die, immediately Zap the closest Unit to you for ^your Intelligence^ Shock Damage.

<Second Try>.Effect: Use after you roll an Unstable Spark die. Reroll it and reset ALL your Cooldowns (except this).

<Double Spark>.Effect:
You roll 2d10 now instead of just 1d10 for Unstable Spark. Apply effects for both.
If both are 10, your first 2 Spells this turn become affected by Magic Mastery instead.

~Artificer~.Effect:
You have a set of Artificer's Tools.
Spending 10 minutes, you can make an item shed light, emmit a sound or smell or paint surfaces in rough images or writing. The magical effects last for up to 8 hours.
When you Create Scroll or Create Elixir, you can instead spend 1 Mana to ignore the Cooldown.
~Artificer~.Notes: Artificer's Tools's small tasks are a non-combat. You can't use them to deal Damage, crowd control or heal. Feel free to be creative with what you can do - the tools might do other small artificer tasks as well. Ask your GM!

~Create Device~.Effect:
Choose a Spell you can cast and spend Mana for it if it requires Mana.
You create a device (or scroll) containing that Spell.
After being used, or at the end of the Adventure, it is destroyed.
~Create Device~.Notes: Devices always take a Half-Action to use and can be used by anyone.

~Create Elixir~.Effect:
Choose one of the following types of potions and create it
{Diamond} Elixir of Healing - Heal for 2d6.
{Diamond} Elixir of Strength - Attacks with 2-Handed weapons deal +2 Damage, and attacks with 1-Handed weapons deal +1 Damage (lasts 1 combat encounter).
{Diamond} Elixir of Agility - Doubled movement speed (lasts for 4 hours).
{Diamond} Elixir of Mana - Gain 1 Mana

<Eclecticism>.Effect: You gain access to the Nature, Mysticism, Eldritch and Divine Ability Lists to Know Basic Abilities from.
<Eclecticism>.Notes: If a Spell requires a certain Level, you need that Level to Know it, as usual.

<Create Magic Weapon>.Effect:
You create a special magical weapon.
Choose a type of weapon, and choose 2 of the following effects:
{Diamond} +1 Damage if it's a One-Handed Weapon (or +2 if it's Two-Handed)
{Diamond} Damage can freely be converted to Fire/Cold/Shock (choose one)
{Diamond} +2 meters move speed while wielding it
{Diamond} Wielder starts combat with 1d6 Shielding
You can only have 1 Magic Weapon created at a time.
The Magic Weapon is automatically destroyed after 24 hours.

<Create Golem>.Effect:
Choose an empty 2x2 meter space and deploy a Golem there that lasts until the end of your next Adventure.
Choose if it's made of Clay, Metal or Flesh. It has different Abilities based on its material. You can find the Golem's stats in the Pets section.
The first time you summon a Golem this Adventure, it costs 1 Mana. Then, every Golem you summon costs 1 Mana more than the previous.
<Create Golem>.Notes: The Golem has 0 initiative, so it usually takes its turn last in combat.

<Create Autoturret>.Effect:
Choose an empty space to deploy an Autoturret of that element.
On your turn, each Autoturret can attack for 1d6 Damage of the chosen type.
It has 10 Health and fails all Checks.
<Create Autoturret>.Notes: Cover from the turrets is applied normally. The turret can't move unless picked up (with a Half-Action) and dropped elsewhere (with 0 Actions).

<Create Grenade>.Effect:
Throw a grenade at a target 5x5x5 meter area.
Choose one of the following effects. It applies to all Units caught in the area.
{Diamond} Units must pass a Might Check or be Stunned and take 1d8 Fire Damage.
{Diamond} Units must pass a Dexterity Check or take 3d8 Smash, Pierce or Slash Damage (you choose) and be knocked away from the center of the area to closest space outside of the edge of the area. If a unit passes, it only takes half of that Damage.
{Diamond} The grenade explodes at the start of your next turn and deals Fire Damage equal to 4d6 + your Intelligence or Charisma (whichever is higher).
<Create Grenade>.Notes: Alternatively, you create the Grenade out of combat and give it to an ally to use. If you do this, only one Grenade can be thrown during a combat. A second grenade has no effect (since it's magical by nature and draws from your magic power). This is considered an attack.

<Create Magic Armor>.Effect:
You magically _enchant_ a piece of armor for the rest of the Adventure.
Apply all of the following effects to it:
{Diamond} +1 Defense
{Diamond} Choose a Damage type. Wearer takes only 50% Damage from that type.
{Diamond} +2 meters Movement Speed, and the wearer can freely jump up to 2 meters (up or ahead; this still uses Movement).
{Diamond} Wearer can fly for up to 5 meters (using its movement) (after flying, it needs to land to take off again).
<Create Magic Armor>.Upgrade: Additionally, the armor can replace missing limbs with construct ones.

<Alchemy>.Effect: You can use Create Elixir 4 times per Adventure.

<Engineering>.Effect: You can use Create Device 4 times per Adventure.

<Create Replica>.Effect:
You create a replica of a non-legendary magic item.
Only one replica of that item can exist.
While the replica exists, you can't create another (you must completely destroy it first, and can do so by touching it).

<Augmentation>.Effect:
You augment your body using chemical, mechanical or magical procedures.
Your Might, Dexterity and Sense increase by 2, your Health by 10

~Vigor~.Effect: You start with 4 extra Max Health.

~Divine Sense~.Effect:
You sense if there are Undead, Demons, Fiends or Celestials, or holy or unholy places or objects within 15 meters.
Thick walls obstruct your Divine Sense.

~Lay on Hands~.Effect:
You have 3 + ^Level^ + ^Sense^ + your ^Charisma^ Holy Points.
Using a Half-Action, you can spend 3 or more Holy Points to heal a Unit for that amount.
All your Holy Points replenish inbetween Adventures.

~Divine Smite~.Effect: Add 2d6 Divine Damage to a melee attack (after you roll).

~Crusade~.Effect:
Every Worthy Enemy YOU defeat grants you 1d4 Holy Points.
You also gain Proficiency in Indimidation if you don't have it already.

~Impose~.Effect: A Unit must pass a Sense Check or be Feared. It has -2 to the roll if it's a Person or Unholy.

<Pledge of the Crusade>.Effect:
Ask a party member to join your cause and pledge their honor to you.
that person can use Divine Smite once per Adventure.
It can also cast Lay on Hands using your Holy Points and always Knows the same Basic Divine Spells you Know at a time.
Additionally, Oath of the Crusade also happens when that ally defeats a Worthy Enemy.
<Pledge of the Crusade>.Notes:
You can only have one character who pledged for you and it must be within 100 meters to have access to all of those.
The number of Holy Points of the ally does not increase.
If you ever change this Talent, the ally loses access to all things mentioned; it regains them when you get this Talent again.

<Fury Smite>.Effect: After an attack, deal 50% of the weapon Damage done by the attack (dice plus any modifiers) to all other Enemies within 3 meters around the target.
<Fury Smite>.Notes:
The Damage of the attack counts as the dice rolled + any modifiers.
Using Divine Smite over an attack, for example, does not count as added to the weapon Damage.
Damage done means Damage inflicted after Defense and Resistances calculations.
Cover is applied normally for the AoE.

<Divine Reach>.Effect:
You empower yourself to make your melee weapons send fiery waves.
Your melee attacks have up to 3 meters range, deal 1d4 extra Damage and deal Fire Damage instead of Physical.
Lasts 1 minute.
Also, passively, you can now cast smites on ranged attacks (normally, you can only cast Smite on melee attacks).
<Divine Reach>.Notes:
Attacks like this count as either melee or ranged attacks, your choice. Targets still benefit from Cover, regardless.
Alternatively, if it makes sense for your character, the DM might allow it to deal Cold, Necrotic or Shock Damage instead of Fire. Talk to your DM about this.

<Vengeance>.Effect:
When a Worthy Enemy dies in combat, get a Vengeance Counter.
Immediately when you get to 6 Vengeance Counters, gain 1 Mana or gain 1d8 Holy Points or reset the Cooldown of a Basic Spell you know (you choose).
You keep your Vengeance Counters even inbetween Adventures.

<Victory Smite>.Effect: After half (rounded down) of Worthy Enemies in a combat have been defeated, reset the Cooldown of Divine Smite or gain 7 Holy Points (you choose).

<Lay on Arms>.Cost: Half of your maximum Holy Points
<Lay on Arms>.Effect:
Use when you or an ally you can see would take Damage from an Enemy.
Make a 1-handed melee weapon attack _against the Enemy's attack_ - subtract your Damage rolled from that enemy's Damage. If your rolled Damage exceeds that enemy's Damage, deal the excess Damage back to the attacker.
<Lay on Arms>.Notes: If you dealt Damage, you can apply weapon effects if any happens.

<Personal Squire>.Effect:
You recruit a squire - a trusted NPC who gains combat powers. However, the capabilities of your squire are random: roll 1d6 to determine the type of your squire, based on the Squires category at Pets and Animals (1. Bold, 2. Sneaky, 3. Clever, 4. Wise). The Race is determined by the GM or by circumstance.
On its turn, it can do one Pet Attack, cast one Ability it has, or do the equivalent of a Half-Action (e.g. Dash, Defend, etc).
You can recruit one squire per Adventure, but only one can follow you in your adventures at a time.
At the start of every Adventure (and when you get this Talent), you must spend 1 Mana and train your Squire to permanently increase its Health by 2 or gain one Ability from any other Squire type.
<Personal Squire>.Upgrade: If your squire drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no reserve Health, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your squire's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Personal Squire>.Notes: Your squire is not a Player Character by any means and does not behave like one (it can't use Weapons, Armor, Feats, Abilities, etc like a Player Character can). It is limited to what its stat block and Abilities say it can do. You can, however, give it orders, customize its looks (hair style, clothes, etc) and it will obey your commands within reason. You are the leader it looks up to. Lead proudly and fairly!

<Motivation Surge>.Effect: After you use Impose, reset the Cooldown of Divine Smite and gain 5 Holy Points.

<Towering Figure>.Effect: Impose now affects 2 targets. After you use Divine Smite, reset the Cooldown of Impose. All Impose targets now have -2 to the roll, not just people.

~Innate Grace~.Effect:
You have 5 more maximum Holy Points.
Healing someone with Lay on Hands for at least 5 Health cures all Crowd Control, diseases, Debuffs and Bleed effects on them.
~Innate Grace~.Notes: Debuffs are things like combat curses, temporary weaknesses, etc.

~Divine Power~.Notes: You can't keep more than your maximum number of Holy Points inbetween Adventures.

<Divine Blast>.Effect:
Spend any number of Holy Points. A Unit takes that many d4's Divine Damage.
You can apply Smites to this attack.

<Shielding Hand>.Effect: Use after an ally (or yourself) takes Damage. After that ally (or yourself) takes Damage, it gains Shielding equal to the Damage taken (after Defense and Resistances). The shield lasts up to 1 minute.

<Focused Smites>.Effect:
For 1 minute, your weapon attacks and offensive spells deal extra Damage and heal an ally within 6 meters of the target (or yourself). All the Damage of these attacks becomes Divine.
Bonus Damage and Heal: 1 for 1-Handed weapons and Half-Action Spells, 2 for 2-Handed weapons and 1 Action Spells.

<Life Echo>.Effect:
You put a Life Echo on another ally.
Whenever YOU heal a different Unit, the unit with the Life Echo on them is also healed for 50% of that amount.
Lasts 1 minute.

<Devotion Aura>.Effect: All allies on your team have +1 Defense if their Defense is 0.
<Devotion Aura>.Notes: Does not stack with itself multiple times (from multiple Paladins).

<Broken Hearts>.Requirement: Only usable if you have 0 Mana remaining
<Broken Hearts>.Effect:
All Units within 4 meters of you must pass a Sense Check or take 2d4 True Damage and be Stunned.
They take half of that Damage if they pass.

<Improved Faith Casting>.Effect:
Your Basic Faith Spells are amplified:
Invigorate now heals for an extra 1d4.
Searing Smite deals an extra 1d4 Damage (both on hit and delayed).
Vindication always heals for an additional of 1d4.

<Divine Resurgence>.Effect: All other Player Characters you healed this combat gain an extra Half-Action on their next turn.

<Asceticism>.Effect: For 1 minute, all Healing you do is increased by 50%, but all Damage you deal is reduced by 50%.

<Assistance From Afar>.Effect: Use when an ally inflicts Crowd Control. That Crowd Control is transformed into a better effect.
<Assistance From Afar>.Upgrade:
^Slowed^ becomes ^Rooted^.
^Fumbling^ becomes ^Blinded^.
Any other harder Crowd Control becomes ^Stunned^.
<Assistance From Afar>.Notes: Hard Terrain is not Crowd Control. All Crowd Controls harder than Slowed, Fumbling, etc become Stunned.

~Templar Knighthood~.Effect:
You stand out for allies adjacent to you.
Enemy ranged attacks against other allies within 1 meter of you have Cover.
~Templar Knighthood~.Notes: Nothing happens if an ally adjacent to you already has Cover. If you are playing on a grid, this does work for allies diagonally.

~Body Block~.Effect:
When another ally is attacked (after the roll), dash to the closest space to that ally.
The attack is now targeted on you instead of the ally.

<Hallowed Ward>.Effect:
You prepare to take a lethal blow.
If you would drop to 0 Health until the start of your next turn, you remain instead at 1 Health and can't take Damage until the start of your next turn.
When this happens, divine rays strike all enemies within 3 meters of you, and they all take 1d10 Divine Damage.

<Reckoning>.Effect:
Make a spell attack on a target for 2d8 Force Damage.
It must pass a Might Check or be Crippled and pushed away from you until the distance between you and the target is 6 meters.
If it stops in a wall or another enemy, it takes another 2d8 Force Damage.

<Silver Circle>.Effect:
The area in a 5 meter diameter circle around you becomes Consacrated.
While inside the area, your and all allies' Divine, Mysticism, Nature and Class Spells (not Abilities) have their dice tier increased by 1.
Does not apply to Passive Spells.
<Silver Circle>.Notes:
Increasing dice by 1 tier means, for example, d6 become d8, or d10 become d12.
D12's and d20's don't increase.
Class Spells are Abilities given by the class (including Talents).

<Warrior Spirits>.Effect:
Whenever you heal with Lay on Hands, you summon a Warrior Spirit near the target with Health equal to the amount restored.
Warrior Spirits have 2 Defense and 4 Speed and can attack for 1d4 Divine Damage. They take their turn on your turn.

<Oath of Revenge>.Effect:
After you use Body Block, you can immediately make an attack (freely) with a 1-Handed Melee Weapon on the attacker.
This attack has 3 meters range and deals True Damage.
You can apply Smites to it.
<Oath of Revenge>.Notes: If the 1-Handed Weapon is not equipped, you quickly and freely equip it, attack, then switch back to your previous weapons.

<Don't Worry Lad>.Effect:
Whenever you use Body Block, you and the ally both gain 1d8 Shielding.
Whenever you use Divine Smite, reset the Cooldown of Body Block.

<Sense of Duty>.Effect: Body Block becomes usable Twice / Combat, and the Damage you take from the redirected attack is reduced by 50%.

~Proficiency in Stealth~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for hiding, remaining quiet, moving silently, blending in a crowd, etc.

~Ambush~.Effect: If you start your turn Hidden, your first weapon attack deals 1d8 extra Damage.
~Ambush~.Notes: Your Specialization will give you extra ways to Ambush.

~Hide~.Effect:
When combat starts, if you have Cover from all enemies, you start as Hidden.
While Hidden, you can skip your turn.
Then, you can unhide and start your turn whenever you like (even during enemies' turns)!
~Hide~.Notes:
Starting your turn unhides you.
Be careful: if you don't start your turn this round, you lose your turn!
If you want to start during an enemy's turn, you do so when they declare they want to do something or after they finish doing something.
In special circumstances, the DM might ask you to make a Dexterity Check to be or remain Hidden.
You can't become Hidden through non-Ability means.

~Backstab~.Effect: When you Flank an enemy, Ambush is applied.
~Backstab~.Upgrade:
When Ambushing, you can also spend as much Mana as you want.
That attack gains 1d8 extra Damage for each Mana spent (on top of the 1d8).
~Backstab~.Notes: Ambush from Hidden and Backstab don't stack (only one d8 is added).

~Agile Hand~.Effect: You are immune to Fumbling. You can freely Break your movement.

~Fool's Gold~.Effect:
After you spend Mana on Ambush, choose one of the rolled dice of the attack (including the base weapon dice and base ambush dice). Gain 10 times that much {Gold}Fool's Gold.
{Gold}Fool's Gold is an imaginary currency that can be converted to real {Gold}Gold by spending 1 hour in a town or city.
{Gold}Fool's Gold lasts until converted to real {Gold}Gold.
Some other Thief Abilities will consume Fool's Gold.
~Fool's Gold~.Notes: Lore-wise, as a Thief, you prepare and build up momentum in combat. When you reach a town, you put your preparations in motion and gain the gold.

<Screw-It Shot>.Effect: A Unit within 2 meters must pass a Dexterity Check or be Stunned.

<Arcane Trickster>.Effect:
You can now cast spells!
Your Intelligence increases by 1 (up to a maximum of 4).
You gain access to the Arcane and Conjuration Basic Ability Lists, but at most half of all your Known Basic Abilities can be Arcane or Conjuration Spells.
Fool's Coin now also applies when spending Mana on a Spell.
<Arcane Trickster>.Notes: You lose access to these Spells if you change this Talent.

<Way of Fooling>.Effect: Your Charisma increases by 2 (up to a maximum of 4).

<Whiplash>.Effect:
Throw a whiplash at a grabbable point within 6 meters.
Pull yourself to a target point.
After using Whiplash, your next weapon attack this turn applies Ambush if you haven't already Ambushed this turn.
<Whiplash>.Notes: Requires a Whiplash item, which can be bought for 100 gold.

<Thief Shock Wire>.Range: 6 meters to end in line of sight
<Thief Shock Wire>.Effect:
Deploy a Shock Tripwire of up to 5 meters long between 2 obstacles.
When a Unit passes through the tripwire, it takes 1d10 Shock Damage and must pass a Dexterity Check with -3 or be Rooted.
<Thief Shock Wire>.Upgrade: A Unit can only see the tripwire only if it has 3 or more Sense.
<Thief Shock Wire>.Notes:
Each end of the wire must be attached to something solid and static.
You can make use of walls, obstacles, etc.
Requires a Special Tripwire Set which can be bought for 100 gold.

<Blade Tempest>.Effect:
Throw 8 shurikens: one towards each direction (north, north-east, east, south, etc).
Each shuriken travels 4 meters, deals 2d6 Slash Damage to all Units it passes through, then stops in place.
At the end of your next turn, each shuriken returns to you, dealing 2d6 Slash Damage again to all Units it passes through.
<Blade Tempest>.Notes: Requires 8 shurikens, which can be bought for a total of 120 gold on a black market. If you're playing on a Grid, take semi-hitting into account for blades that don't travel squares exactly in the 8 directions. Cover applies normally to each blade.

<Poisoned Weapons>.Effect:
Choose 2 weapons, and choose a different poison to apply for each:
{Diamond} Deathly Venom: Deals 1d8 extra Damage to targets with more than 50% Health, and all the Damage type Poison Damage; then the target becomes immune to this poison for 1 minute.
{Diamond} Necrotic Toxin: The attack's target becomes Slowed and can't regain Health for 1 minute.
{Diamond} Phosphorus Mix: The target can't benefit from Cover for 1 minute (and this attack ignores Cover).
{Diamond} Weakening Poison: The target deals 1 less Damage on all Attacks
<Poisoned Weapons>.Notes:
Remember to specify which weapon you are attacking with.
Requires a Poisoner's Kit which can be bought for 200 gold on a black market. If you're in a tight scenario, the GM might let you use monster blood or gather herbs for a 1-time use of this Ability.
Onl Epic Monsters, Weakening Poison applies to their first turn every round only.

<Savage Ambush>.Effect:
When you declare an attack on a Unit that has 50% or less Health (before your attack's Damage), the attack gain Ambush.
Ambush can apply twice at the same time, from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Savage Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if you Ambush the target and it also has 50% or less Health, the total Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and you would also Ambush from your Specialization Ambush Ability condition, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
The maximum Damage is 2d8, even if you match 3 conditions for Ambush (e.g. Hiding, Savage Ambush and your Specialization's Ambush Ability).
You can still add Ambush Damage only once per turn (e.g. not with 2 separate attacks; it must be one single attack).

<First-Shot Ambush>.Effect:
When you declare an attack on a Unit that has full Health, the attack gain Ambush.
Ambush can apply twice at the same time, from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<First-Shot Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if you Ambush the target and it also has full Health, then the total Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and you would also Ambush from your Specialization Ambush Ability condition, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
The maximum Damage is 2d8, even if you match 3 conditions for Ambush (e.g. Hiding, First-Shot Ambush and your Specialization's Ambush Ability).
You can still add Ambush Damage only once per turn (e.g. not with 2 separate attacks; it must be one single attack).

<Instinctive Ambush>.Effect:
After you use a 0 Actions Ability, your next weapon attack this turn gains Ambush.
Ambush can happen twice per turn (even at the same time) from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Instinctive Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if you just used a 0 Actions Ability but you would Ambush anyway, the Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and you would also Ambush from your Specialization Ambush Ability condition, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
Or, if you were hiding and Ambush, then use a 0 Actions Ability, then attack again, that second attack also gains Ambush (1d8 extra Damage).

~Isolated~.Effect: When you attack a Unit, and there is no other Unit within 1 meter of either of you, the attack gains Ambush.
~Isolated~.Upgrade:
When Ambushing, you can also spend as much Mana as you want.
That attack gains 1d8 extra Damage for each Mana spent (on top of the 1d8).
~Isolated~.Notes: Ambush from Hidden and Isolated don't stack (only one d8 is added).

<Take Out>.Effect:
A non-Epic Unit within 1 meter must pass a Dexterity Check or be put to Sleep for 1 minute.
If it fails, you gain the Half-Action back.
<Take Out>.Downside:
You must be hiding to use Take Out, and the target must be Isolated.
This ability unhides you!

<Poison Master>.Effect:
Using ingredients costing 35 Gold, you are able to create a few drops of Drinkable Poison.
Someone ingesting them takes 1d12 Poison Damage instantly.
Combining multiple instances of Drinkable Poison increases its Damage by 1d12 for each Drinkable Poison combined.
The poison loses its effect after 72 hours.

<Shadowstep>.Effect:
If you are covered in shadow, choose another point covered in shadow up to 6 meters away.
Instantly teleport to that place.

<Planned Assassination>.Effect:
You plan an attack for 1 minute.
Your next weapon attack on that target deals an extra 1d12 Damage.
Planned Assassination fails if your Line of Sight to the target is broken until you attack it.
<Planned Assassination>.Notes: The Mana is spent the moment you declare Planned Assassination. You can use plan assassinations on multiple targets, but you can't plan an assassination on a single target multiple times at the same time.

<Death Mark>.Effect:
Mark a Unit you can see.
Whenever YOU deal Damage to it until your next turn, remember the Damage done.
At the start of your next turn, the mark bursts and the Unit takes 50% of the Damage it has taken in this time period (directly, ignoring Defense).

<Finale>.Effect: For each attack, Ability and application of Ambush you made this turn, deal 1d10 Damage that ignores Defense.

~Savagery~.Effect: When you declare an attack on a Unit that has 50% or less Health (before your attack's Damage), the attack gain Ambush.
~Savagery~.Upgrade:
When Ambushing, you can also spend as much Mana as you want.
That attack gains 1d8 extra Damage for each Mana spent (on top of the 1d8).
~Savagery~.Notes: Ambush from Hidden and Savagery don't stack (only one d8 is added).

~Parry~.Effect: Halve the Damage of a weapon attack you receive (when you see the roll, before subtracting modifiers like Defense, Resistances, etc).

<10% Luck>.Effect: Once per Round, when you roll a 1 for a Damage die, you can reroll that die.

<Cheap Tricks>.Effect: A Unit within 3 meters must pass a Dexterity Check or take 1d4 Poison Damage and be Blinded.

<Quickfire>.Effect:
Perform an attack with a 1-Handed weapon (for 0 Actions).
This attack ignores Cover and has no pentaly if you're Blinded or Fumbling.
This attack can be used in melee range without penalty if it's a ranged weapon.

<Combat Shock Wire>.Range: 6 meters to end in line of sight
<Combat Shock Wire>.Effect:
Whenever you spend one or more Mana, freely deploy a Shock Tripwire of up to 5 meters long between 2 obstacles.
When a Unit passes through the tripwire, it takes 1d10 Shock Damage and must pass a Dexterity Check with -3 or be Rooted.
A Unit can see the tripwire only if it has 3 or more Sense.
<Combat Shock Wire>.Notes:
Each end of the wire must be attached to something solid and static.
You can make use of walls, obstacles, etc.
Requires a Special Tripwire Set which can be bought for 200 gold.

<Swing Thing>.Effect:
Use when a Unit within 6 meters becomes affected by Crowd Control of any type except Slow (including being Pushed) (you must have line of sight to it).
Deal 1d10 Pierce Damage to it and push it up to 3 meters in any direction.
<Swing Thing>.Notes:
Requires a Whiplash item for pushing towards you or to a side, which can be bought for 100 gold.
For pushing away from you, requires a gun or crossbow of any type.

<Backstab Ambush>.Effect:
When you Flank an enemy, the attack gains Ambush.
Ambush can apply twice at the same time, from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Backstab Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if the target has 50% or less Health and you're also Flanking it, the total Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and the target would also have 50% or less Health, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
The maximum Damage is 2d8, even if you match 3 conditions for Ambush (e.g. Hiding, 50% Health and Flanking).
You can still add Ambush Damage only once per turn (e.g. not with 2 separate attacks; it must be one single attack).

<Isolated Ambush>.Effect:
When you attack a Unit, and there is no other Unit within 1 meter of either of you, the attack gains Ambush.
Ambush can apply twice at the same time, from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Isolated Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if the target has 50% or less Health and it's also Isolated, the total Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and the target would also have 50% or less Health, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
The maximum Damage is 2d8, even if you match 3 conditions for Ambush (e.g. Hiding, 50% Health and Flanking).
You can still add Ambush Damage only once per turn (e.g. not with 2 separate attacks; it must be one single attack).

<Momentum Dance>.Effect: Gain Shielding equal to your current Initiative in combat.

~Proficiency in Occultism~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for knowing about demons or undead, rituals, myths or cryptids, black magic, etc.

~Echoes~.Cooldown: Each Spell can only echo once per Combat
~Echoes~.Effect:
After you cast a Basic Ability you spent Mana on, if you roll maximum on at least one ^immediate^ Damage or Healing die, the Ability _echoes_ and you cast it again (for 0 Actions), but all Damage or Healing it does is reduced by 50%.
The _echoed_ Ability can't affect the same target(s) or area.
~Echoes~.Notes:
Immediate means not delayed, not over time, etc (e.g. Scorching Rays, Healing Surge, Mind Blast are immediate; Explosion Rune, Curse of Pain, etc are not immediate). _Echoing_ can only happen if you roll maximum on the initial cast (when you spend the Mana), even if there's more Damage or Healing later (e.g. Crackling Lightning _echoes_ only if you roll maximum the moment you cast it).
If the area overlaps the initial area, the overlapped part has no effect. If it hits the same target(s), it has no effect on them.
Take the Ability text as it is - _echoing_ Lightning Storm repeats the initial Damage, but you'd have to spend another 1 Action to retrigger the second Lightning Storm.
The GM has the word on whether something is possible.

~Mind Link~.Effect:
Establish a mind connection with a willing ally.
For the rest of the Adventure, you can talk to eachother telepathically.

~Path of the Berserker~.Effect:
Instead of having normal Reserve Health, all your Reserve Health is added to your Max Health (and as such your Reserve Health is always 0).
Restoring Reserve Health Heals you instead (and losing Reserve Health loses you Max Health instead).
~Path of the Berserker~.Notes: Remember to recalculate your Max Health whenever you increase your Reserve Health or your Max Health.

~Bloodlust~.Effect: Add Damage to a weapon attack equal to 50% of your missing Health.
~Bloodlust~.Notes: This is not considered a Spell.

<Primal Trophy>.Effect:
Whenever ^YOU^ kill a Worthy Enemy, gain one Primal Trophy. Every 3 Primal Trophies increase your "Reserve Health" by 1.
Every 10 Primal Trophies give you an extra Proficiency.

<Cold Vigor>.Effect: Heal for 10% of your Max Health and remove diseases from yourself.

<Spirit Animal>.Effect:
A spirit animal assists you and gives you a boon, depending on its type.
You can change which spirit animal assists you while not in Combat.
<Spirit Animal>.Upgrade: The spirit animal is intangible, and invisible to most people, but can't walk through solid surfaces. You can see through its eyes, but is bound to you and won't go more than 15 meters away from you.
<Spirit Animal>.Notes: An Act counts as ranged if it's not made with a melee weapon, and the range is at least 3 meters

Values: You are immune to Slows and Fumbling

<Earthshattering Wave>.Effect:
All units in a line must pass a Might Check or be Stunned. If they pass, they become Fumbling instead.
The line is 3 meters wide, and has a length of 1 meter for ever 5 Health you are missing.
<Earthshattering Wave>.Notes:
E.g. if you have 30 out of 50 Health (thus missing 20 Health), then the line will be 4 meters long.
Cover is applied normally.

<Ruining Shout>.Effect:
Damages all Enemies within 4 meters of you.
Deals 1d6 Psychic Damage (directly, ignoring Defense) for each 1 meter to the target (up to 4d6).
Roll 4d6 at the same time, and choose which dice affect the units closer.

<Tribal Tattoos>.Effect:
Your "Reserve Health" is further increased by 8.
Every Adventure, you add another tattoo and increase it by 1.
Every 3 new tattoos, gain +1 in any Resist Check of choice.

<Jotunn>.Effect:
You grow to the size of a giant and become Large.
You gain Shielding equal to 50% of your missing Health.
Your normal Melee attacks hit all Units within 1 meter of the target for the same Damage, without the Stat modifier (e.g. you don't add your Might or Dexterity to the secondary targets).
You are immune to being Slowed, Rooted, Crippled, Fumbling and to Hard Terrain.

<Echoing Strikes>.Effect: Your weapon attacks can _echo_ (if you roll one maximum die).

<Forced Echoes>.Notes: You don't spend Health or Reserve Health again if any Talents require that.

~Spirit Bond~.Effect:
Touch another ally.
Whenever either of you makes a Check, add the higher bonus from either of you instead of their normal Check bonus.
~Spirit Bond~.Notes: This does apply to Proficiencies - if your bonded ally has Proficiency in something, you also add the ally's Level, as it would normally make sense.

~Third Echo~.Effect: When you roll dice for your _echoed_ Spell, if you roll maximum on any of the _echoed_ dice as well, the Spell _echoes_ a third time!

<Incorporeal Form>.Effect:
You become a bodyless soul for up to 8 hours and enter a willing ally.
While inside the ally's body, you can communicate with them mentally, and only they can see you.
You can slightly peek outside of their body, and move your arms, upper body and head as if you were a ghost originating from that ally's body.
{Diamond} You can't move yourself, but you always move with that ally.
{Diamond} You can't do any physical actions (because you are a ghost and can't touch anything or anyone).
{Diamond} You can cast spells normally. 
{Diamond} You follow your own Initiative in combat.
